thread.title: Will Carnival's cruises to Cuba spoil everything? Maybe not

author: senh
title: Will Carnival's cruises to Cuba spoil everything? Maybe not
text: BING NEWS: Carnival’s New Sailings to Cuba Could Include Several Port Calls on the Island Prior Experience in Cuba It won’t be a blank slate, though. Donald pointed out that Carnival’s Costa Cruises brand actually managed the Havana cruise terminal before the 1960 U.S. trade embargo was imposed. This was before Carnival acquired Costa in 2000. 07/8/2015 - 11:41 am | View Link Carnival plans Cuba cruises in May Carnival's 710-passenger Adonia is slated to begin cruises to Cuba from Miami next year, starting at $2,990 per person plus taxes and port fees. U.S. regulations require visitors to Cuba to spend at least eight hours daily involved in some type of cultural ... 07/8/2015 - 11:18 am | View Link US allows cruises to Cuba; Carnival plans trips from Miami in May Cruise giant Carnival Corp. announced Tuesday that it has received U.S. government licenses to offer "purposeful" cruises ... Cuba without a prior license in 12 categories of travel, including the people-to-people type tours now planned by Carnival's ... 07/8/2015 - 9:18 am | View Link Will Carnival's cruises to Cuba spoil everything? Not if its Fathom brand can help it Just what you didn't want to see happen in Cuba: the coming of cruises disgorging thousands onto the shores of the island nation. But hold the phone. The announcement Tuesday that Carnival Corp. will begin sailing to Cuba in May may have raised the "that ... 07/8/2015 - 5:31 am | View Link Carnival’s fathom cruises to Cuba in 2016 It was at the start of June that Carnival announced its new cruise line called fathom, without a capital f. At that time we had limited details as to what its itineraries will be, although we did know that P&O’s Adonia would become part of the new fleet ...
